por que es entretenidoNice

First keep in mind I played through on the hardest difficulty, maybe the normal difficulty fixes some parts of the game idk.I really REALLY wanna give this game a positive review, the gameplay is superb the gun play is challenging and interactive. The ammo and health pickups aren't scarce, but they certainly aren't plentiful which makes the constant search for said ammo and health feel less like a chore. The enemy designs are amazing, each one makes noises and looks completely different from one another making it easy to pick out which enemies your fighting. but...  but this is not enough to make up for huge flaws. Firstly, several enemies are just down right mean to the player. Not in their difficulty, but in their placement. I thought most enemies were fine, those invisible guys are such an un-fun enemy. They have the health of a military soldier, they are invisible, they are very quick, and they fire fast guns that deal massive damage. most areas of this game were forgettable at worst, but the fucking minefield bullshit was some complete dogshit. the mines trigger-boxes™ were larger than they should have been and there is no way to find where they are without wasting 50 bullets on shooting the ground. The mines do not have a different coloring, they do not make noise when you get near them, they just explode. You end up wasting your, as I stated earlier, valuable ammo or just have to trial and error it with saving and loading. But the biggest problem by a million miles is how fucking glitch prone this game is. I get it, its old and i'm about to play Black Mesa so hopefully i'll have a better time there. Anyway I cant explain how many fucking game breaking glitches I got during my playtime. I don't want to spoil anything here so if you want to know the ones I remember or have a convo, we can do it in the comments. Anyway I feel bad about the rating but its how I feel.5/10, just disappointing given its god status.
This is one of the best video games I have ever played.

This game shows how far games have come.Sure, it was defining for its own era, but it shows its age (crosshairs, greased-roller skate movement, etc.). It can stir up some nostalgia, but even so sometimes it's just best to let memories be memories.

Y E S

El pionero de los FPS con énfasis narrativo es ahora considerado como una obra importantísima para la historia del medio, y no es para menos. Ofrece un acercamiento a la narrariva en tiempo real que luego heredaría su sucesor, Half-Life 2, que logra muy bien establecernos en el contexto de su universo (aunque sea algo simplista).Su gameplay varía entre cagarse a tiros con alienígenas o con militares, e interactuar con el mundo que rodea al Gordon Hombre Libre, ya sea resolviendo algún que otro puente roto o puzzle o utilizando a la inteligencia artificial a nuestro favor. Y hablando un poco sobre la misma, voy a ser sincero, la I.A. envejeció mal. Mínimo algún que otro parche hubiera bastado, pero los NPCs se siguen bugeando.También el juego peca de poder sufrir disonancias ludonarrativas, y aclaro lo de PODER sufrirlas porque es el jugador quien decide si realizarlas o no, por ejemplo, matando a científicos porque si, aunque no encaje con lo que haría Gordon. El juego debería penalizar esa conducta a fin de mantener la integridad narrativa. Es un caso similar al de GTA IV, pero ahí es mucho peor.Aún asi, eso no quita que el juego me siga pareciendo muy importante para la historia de los videojuegos, y que marcó un antes y un después en la forma de creación de los mismos y comó narrar sus historias. Muy recomendable."8.5/10"

This is one of the few games I can come back to over, and over, and over again and just never get sick of. The way this game is paced, the way the intensity builds up throughout the course of the campaign is just so satisfying. And the soundtrack just rocks, with each replay I'm always looking forward to the next set-piece and accompanying banger. Half-Life is a classic, and one of the best shooters ever made.

Even 22 years after it's initial release, the game still holds up and I would cosider it a must play, even just to experience this legendary game for once in your life. 
The gameplay itself and the atmosphere are still great, and the only negatives are the awkward platforming, some frustrating bosses, and obviously that the graphics haven't aged well. 

If you can live with the outdated graphics, there is nothing that can hold you back from playing this.
Otherwise the Black Mesa remake is supposed to be great.

When Half-Life 3?

This game is super close to being a masterpiece. I always put off buying and playing half life for a long time. A few months ago i bought all of them and i was blown away. The game is 22 years old but doesnt feel very clunky or outdated. The gameplay requires a decent amount of skill and strategy because of the games difficulty. The story is well made and the DLC expands on it a lot as well. Sadly the ending isnt nearly as cohesive as the rest of the game. Levels are uninteresting, bland and longer than needed. If you enjoy single player FPS games this should 100% be in your library.

im with the science team

This is a completely revolutionary fps for the time, but yes it has aged quite a bit. Firstly the graphics aren't to hot and the bullets feel kind of weird. Also I heard that valve won a prize for making the smallest aiming reticle possible. And while I'm sure some of this sounds bad if your willing to look past these issues you got a great game. The story is captivating except for around the middle were it feels like your kind of just going down a never ending tunnel of tasks. But the first 6 and the last 4 chapters are awesome because there able to tell so much story without any crazy cutscenes. And the selection of weapons are out standing for the time considering each gun has there pros and cons. And there are multiple ways of going after and enemy and you kind of pick your own play style. The world is massive and lively the story (for the most part) is stellar the shooting and graphics are kind of meh but it's all worth it. Definitly reccomend this game to a person willing to let go of issues like un modern graphics and game design to experience a classic gem valve has made changing PC fps for ever.

This is just such a good game, even over 20 years later. I personally prefer the older graphics 2, since I'm used to them (the HD ones squick me out). There are definitely a couple times when I got stuck, but the game is great at making it clear what you're supposed to do and where you're supposed to go. That being said there is a lot of trial and error (though I did my first run ever at medium difficulty) and you might die a lot. Still, a super fun and interesting game!

Assim como DOOM, Half-Life foi um dos responsáveis pela popularização do gênero FPS. Apesar de o jogo já mostrar a sua idade, jogá-lo ainda é uma experiência divertida: desde a narrativa ininterrupta que se desenrola diante de seus olhos, às táticas implementadas pela AI dos inimigos na tentativa de te eliminar e a trilha sonora composta pelo fantástico Kelly Bailey. Embora o fan remake Black Mesa também esteja disponível para compra na Steam, eu ainda recomendo jogar Half-Life nem que seja pra vivenciar a experiência original. E se você vier a jogar Black Mesa em seguida, isso só vai te fazer apreciar ainda mais o trabalho da Crowbar Collective.
